content:
Caution! Being hazardous and explosive, all of the nitro aromatics should be handled carefully.

Physical Measurements

All spectroscopic and crystallographic studies are provided in the Supporting Information.

Synthesis of the Ligand

Ligand 4-(1H-triazole-1-yl) benzoic acid was prepared by following a literature method and characterized by elemental, 1H and 13C NMR, and ESI–MS analyses (see the Supporting Information).

Synthesis of <bold>1</bold>

A mixture of Cd­(NO3)2·4H2O (30.8 mg, 0.1 mmol) and 4-(4-carboxyphenyl)-1,2,4-triazole (HL) (37.8 mg, 0.2 mmol) was dissolved in 7 mL of DMF, and heated in a 15 mL glass vial at 120 °C for 36 h. Colorless, needle-shaped crystals were isolated in 62% yield, washed with DMF, and dried in air. FT-IR (KBr pellets, cm–1): 3468 br, 2934 w, 1683 s, 1382 s, 1252 m, 970 s, 867 s, 784 s, 660 s. Anal. Calcd for CdC18H12N6O4·0.92­(C3H7NO) = ([Cd­( L )2]·0.92DMF): C, 44.84; H, 3.34; N, 17.42. Found: C, 44.95; H, 3.40; N, 17.30.

Synthesis of Isoskeletal Frameworks (<bold>2</bold>–<bold>4</bold>)

Compounds 2–4 were synthesized following a procedure similar to that of 1, except using solvent DEF for 2, DBF for 3, and NMF for 4. Colorless, needle-shaped crystals were isolated in 52%, 40%, and 35% yield, respectively. The crystals were washed with solvent, used for the synthesis, and finally dried in air. All of the isoskeletal frameworks upon activation (vide supra) provided a similar molecular formula [Cd­( L )2]. Anal. Calcd for C18H12N6O4Cd [Cd­( L )2]: C, 44.24; H, 2.47; N, 17.20. Found: C, 44.18; H, 2.55; N, 17.12.
clean_text:
Caution! Being hazardous and explosive, all of the nitro aromatics should be handled carefully.

Physical Measurements

All spectroscopic and crystallographic studies are provided in the Supporting Information.

Synthesis of the Ligand

Ligand 4-(1H-triazole-1-yl) benzoic acid was prepared by following a literature method and characterized by elemental, 1H and 13C NMR, and ESI-MS analyses (see the Supporting Information).

Synthesis of 1 

A mixture of Cd(NO3)2⋅4H2O (30.8 mg, 0.1 mmol) and 4-(4-carboxyphenyl)-1,2,4-triazole (HL) (37.8 mg, 0.2 mmol) was dissolved in 7 mL of DMF, and heated in a 15 mL glass vial at 120 °C for 36 h. Colorless, needle-shaped crystals were isolated in 62% yield, washed with DMF, and dried in air. FT-IR (KBr pellets, cm-1): 3468 br, 2934 w, 1683 s, 1382 s, 1252 m, 970 s, 867 s, 784 s, 660 s. Anal. Calcd for CdC18H12N6O4⋅0.92(C3H7NO) = ([Cd( L )2]⋅0.92DMF): C, 44.84; H, 3.34; N, 17.42. Found: C, 44.95; H, 3.40; N, 17.30.

Synthesis of Isoskeletal Frameworks (2-4)

Compounds 2-4 were synthesized following a procedure similar to that of 1, except using solvent DEF for 2, DBF for 3, and NMF for 4. Colorless, needle-shaped crystals were isolated in 52%, 40%, and 35% yield, respectively. The crystals were washed with solvent, used for the synthesis, and finally dried in air. All of the isoskeletal frameworks upon activation (vide supra) provided a similar molecular formula [Cd( L )2]. Anal. Calcd for C18H12N6O4Cd [Cd( L )2]: C, 44.24; H, 2.47; N, 17.20. Found: C, 44.18; H, 2.55; N, 17.12.
